intro: Eriospermum setiferum, commonly known as the woolly eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive, fluffy, white to pale yellow flowers that resemble a cloud or a ball of wool. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Eriospermum setiferum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
